entity.name: Rahul Dass
entity.description: Founder & Core Maintainer of QWED Protocol, building the deterministic verification layer for AI.

projects.name: QWED Protocol (Core)
projects.description: The first open-source Neurosymbolic AI Verification Layer. QWED prevents hallucinations in high-stakes LLM applications (Math, Finance, Logic) by using deterministic engines (SymPy, Z3, AST) to verify AI outputs.

projects.name: QWED Tax
projects.description: Specialized tax compliance verification guards for Cross-Border Tax, Transfer Pricing, and GST/VAT.

projects.name: QWED Legal
projects.description: Legal reasoning verification using IRAC framework and citation checking for AI lawyers.

projects.name: QWED Finance
projects.description: Financial statement verification, formula checks (NPV/IRR), and ISO 20022 compliance.

projects.name: QWED UCP (Unified Compliance)
projects.description: Unified Compliance Platform integration for regulatory reporting and real-time auditing.

plans.name: QWED Infrastructure Sustainability Grant
plans.description: QWED is currently maintained primarily by a single core maintainer. Funding supports long-term sustainability of this deterministic AI verification infrastructure, including security hardening, threat modeling, CI/CD enforcement, SBOM generation, supply-chain protection, documentation improvements, and ecosystem integrations. External funding directly increases reliability and reduces downstream risk for organizations relying on QWED in high-stakes AI deployments.

plans.name: Extended Security & Audit Support
plans.description: Supports extended runway for infrastructure stability, third-party security reviews, container hardening, deterministic engine validation, compliance preparation (OpenSSF Gold, SBOM attestation), and contributor onboarding. Enables structured security audits and long-term ecosystem growth.

history.description: Active development phase. Infrastructure hardened via OSS ecosystem programs (Docker DSOS, Snyk, CircleCI, Cloudflare, Sonar, CodeRabbit). Scaling deterministic verification engines and compliance readiness.
